jobs.title: Onboarder marketplace - CDI (H/F)
jobs.description:
ZeTrace accompagne les entreprises dans leurs projets de transformation, en recrutant les meilleurs profils pour relever les défis d'aujourd'hui et construire les solutions de demain.Nous aidons nos clients à identifier et attirer les meilleurs talents avec une approche sur mesure, humaine et engagée.Dans le cadre du développement de sa marketplace, nous recrutons pour l'un de nos clients dans le domaine des produits high tech un onboarder marketplace (H/F).Dans cette optique, vous participez à un projet stratégique et stimulant au sein d'une structure dynamique, avec des perspectives d'évolution réelles.
Le PosteEn tant qu'Onboarder, vous jouerez un rôle central pour activer les marchands sur la plateforme Mirakl :Accompagnement des vendeurs sur les aspects techniques et back officeAide à la structuration et au mapping du catalogue (produits, stocks, prix, attributs)Formation à l'environnement Mirakl Seller PortalSuivi des étapes de KYC, conformité juridique et qualité contenuSupport de niveau 1 pour les incidents liés à l'intégration
ProfilBac +3/5 en commerce, support digital, ou IT+ 3 ans d'expérience sur un poste similaireMaitrise de Mirakl ou d'un back-office marketplace leader sur le marchéAppétence pour le domaine des produits high techRigueur, sens du service, autonomie et pédagogie

jobs.title: Responsable communications marketing
jobs.description:
🌍 Qui sommes-nous ?Chez Nexteneo, on est convaincus que la mobilité électrique doit être intelligente, fluide et durable pour relever les défis énergétiques et climatiques.Notre mission ? Rendre la recharge des véhicules électriques plus simple et plus efficace grâce à notre solution SaaS de pilotage et supervision de bornes de recharge. 🔌Notre équipe s’agrandit, et on recherche un.e Responsable Communication & Marketing pour rejoindre l’aventure ! 🚀
🎯 Vos missionsEn tant que Responsable Communication & Marketing, vous occuperez un rôle stratégique et transversal, en lien direct avec la direction générale. Vous interviendrez sur :
✅ Stratégie de marque & positionnement : Définir la plateforme de marque et garantir une cohérence forte sur l’ensemble des canaux (branding, messages clés, charte graphique, ton éditorial).✅ Communication corporate et institutionnelle : Développer la notoriété et l’image de Nexteneo auprès des clients, partenaires, investisseurs et médias.✅ Génération de leads & acquisition : définir et piloter la stratégie digitale (SEO, SEA, campagnes, contenus), optimiser le site web comme funnel d’acquisition et assurer le suivi des parcours marketing avec l’équipe commerciale.✅ Supports & contenus : Garantir la cohérence et la qualité des supports de communication (print, site web, kakémonos, présentations commerciales et corporate).✅ Pilotage marketing : Élaborer et exécuter un plan marketing multicanal (site web, social media, campagnes, contenus).✅ Événementiel & relations publiques : Identifier les salons et événements clés, assurer la visibilité de l’entreprise, gérer les relations presse et partenaires.✅ Management & coordination : Superviser une équipe (prestataires, freelance, futurs collaborateurs) et assurer la bonne exécution des projets.✅ Reporting & KPIs : Mettre en place et suivre des indicateurs de performance (trafic, leads générés, taux de conversion, ROI campagnes).
🔥 Pourquoi nous rejoindre ? - Un rôle stratégique au cœur de la croissance de Nexteneo  - La possibilité de façonner une marque innovante en pleine expansion  - Un environnement dynamique : startups, entrepreneurs et innovation au Village by CA  - Un impact positif : contribuer à une transition énergétique plus verte 
🎯 Profil recherché - 5+ ans d’expérience en communication et marketing, dont une expérience réussie en poste de responsabilité/management, idéalement en B2B (startup/scale-up un plus). - Expérience confirmée en stratégie de marque, communication digitale, génération de leads et optimisation de funnels d’acquisition. - Maîtrise des leviers digitaux : SEO, SEA, campagnes payantes, outils CRM/marketing automation, analytics. - Excellentes capacités rédactionnelles et sens du storytelling. - Anglais courant (B2/C1).

jobs.title: Webdesigner - Marketing Department (F/M)
jobs.description:
Prêt(e) à vous déployer ?  ✨ Alors bienvenue chez Rakuten France ! A vous :
le projet exaltantle mouvement et les perspectivesle plaisir de se lever le matinle management qui fait grandirl’envergure et la taille humaine
Si vous vous retrouvez dans nos piliers, rejoignez l’équipe Webdesign au poste de Webdesigner ! 
A propos de l’équipe Marketing :Chez Rakuten France, l’équipe Marketing est composée de 6 équipes : la Monétisation, l’Acquisition, le Category Management, le CRM, le C2C, l’équipe Merchandising & Webdesign. Ces équipes sont au cœur de la stratégie de Rakuten France et travaillent sur des sujets transverses, impactants et qui impliquent énormément de data.L’équipe travaille au quotidien autour de notre programme de fidélité, le Club R, qui possède une stratégie unique rassemblant 13 millions de membre et plus de 2 000 partenaires.L’aspect éco-responsable est également au cœur de la stratégie avec notre équipe C2C qui pilote toute l’activité d’achat entre particuliers.L’équipe marketing est attachée au partage et à l’apprentissage. L’esprit collaboratif, bienveillant et dynamique est présent au quotidien ce qui permet de voir les projets se réaliser rapidement.
A propos de l’équipe Webdesign :Rattachée à l’équipe Merchandising, l’équipe Webdesign réalise tous les visuels des opérations marketing.Plus précisément, l’équipe Webdesign a pour projet de définir l’identité graphique des différentes bannières du site ainsi que la création des chartes pour les différents services de Rakuten (ainsi que la création de l’UX global des différentes pages commerciales). Elle travaille avec les différentes équipes Marketing (Merch, CRM, Acquisition, Monétisation) afin d'assurer une cohérence graphique globale.
Votre rôle : Vous serez en charge de la conception et de la déclinaison des projets créatifs pour les supports de communication digitaux multicanaux. Rattaché(e) à notre Webdesign Manager, vous serez responsable de la production visuelle des campagnes commerciales et des diverses chartes graphiques. Vous participerez à la valorisation de l’image de marque en garantissant un design cohérent, impactant et performant.
Vos missions : 
1/ Production & exécutionConcevoir, décliner et livrer des supports visuels à forte valeur ajoutée : landing pages, emailings, bannières web, visuels pour les réseaux sociaux, supports commerciaux, etc.Création de wireframes et prototypes de pages web en s’appuyant sur notre design system ;Améliorer l’expérience utilisateur sur les pages existantes ;Adapter les concepts créatifs aux différents formats, en tenant compte des contraintes techniques, des objectifs marketing et des délais.Assurer la bonne intégration des chartes graphiques et design system dans chaque production et participer à leur évolution.Collaboration avec les équipes marketing, développeurs, et rédacteurs pour assurer la cohérence des projets.Veille créative et technologique pour proposer des formats et tendances innovants.
2/ Soutien à la Direction ArtistiqueTravailler en étroite collaboration avec notre Webdesign Manager sur la direction artistique pour garantir la cohérence de l’identité visuelle.
Votre profil :Maîtrise des outils de design graphique : Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), Figma (design system, prototypage, collaboration).Solides bases en UX/UI design.Compétences en intégration HTML/CSS (responsive).Connaissance d’outil d’intégration CRM est un plus.Très bonne compréhension des enjeux marketing et de la performance visuelle, sensible à la sémiologie.Créatif(ve), intéressé(e) par les tendances web, goût prononcé pour l’exécution soignée, le sens du détail et la rapidité d’exécution.Sens de l’organisation, rigueur et autonomie.Curiosité, capacité d’adaptation, esprit d’équipe et bonnes qualités relationnelles.
Les Avantages de Rakuten🏠 Une politique de télétravail flexible, incluant une participation mensuelle🏤 De superbes bureaux au cœur de Paris (Sentier)🍜 Une carte tickets restaurant🌴 12 RTT annuels, en plus des 25 jours de congés🎉 Des moments de convivialité organisés toute l’année📈 Programme avantageux de stock-options Rakuten Group🌎 Des équipes multiculturelles & internationales🚆 Une prise en charge à 50% de votre titre de transport et de votre mutuelle d’entreprise✨ Des programmes de well-being, santé mentale et de charity🎬 Des avantages avec notre CSE
Si vous vous reconnaissez dans ces différents points et que vous avez envie de rejoindre des équipes motivées, talentueuses & bienveillantes alors vous êtes la bonne personne, c’est pour vous l’occasion de participer à l’évolution d’une marketplace qui met au cœur de sa stratégie ses marchands et ses membres.
Process de recrutementPréqualification avec Céline, notre Talent Acquisition LeadRencontre avec Bruna, Webdesign ManagerCas pratique
Rakuten reconnait et intègre tous les talents. Nous assurons un processus de recrutement inclusif et non discriminant (il n'est pas nécessaire de mentionner votre âge, votre situation familiale, votre lieu d'habitation, ni de joindre votre photo).

jobs.title: Marketing & Player Acquisition Manager H/F
jobs.description:
Job Description

Already the market leader in UGC games in France (Minecraft), Rivrs aims to become a global leader in UGC studios (Minecraft, Roblox, Fortnite, GTA, and more). Our ambitious plans include opening international branches (USA/Canada, Germany), developing our own IPs on existing and upcoming UGC platforms (Hytale, GTA, and more), acquiring independent studios worldwide, and expanding into licensing and merchandising.

As the Marketing Manager at Rivrs, a UGC-focused video game studio, you will be responsible for driving an effective player acquisition strategy across multiple channels. You will manage and implement a creative acquisition strategy using both organic and paid channels, focusing on long-term growth in key markets (FR/US). You’ll work closely with influencers, content creators, and internal teams to ensure Rivrs reaches and engages its target audience effectively.

Key Responsibilities

Acquisition Strategy & Campaign Management:

Develop and execute a creative player acquisition strategy using both organic and paid advertising methods.Manage advertising campaigns across multiple platforms (e.g., TikTok, Snapchat, Instagram) ensuring optimization and effective use of resources.Propose and implement innovative strategies to improve player acquisition and drive user growth.

Influencer Strategy & Collaboration:

Build and manage a long-term influencer strategy for the FR/US markets.Source, negotiate, and manage contracts with influencers and content creators, ensuring alignment with brand and marketing goals.Monitor and report on the performance and results of influencer collaborations.

Content Creator Engagement:

Develop strong relationships with content creators to promote organic growth through user-generated content.Oversee content collaboration projects, ensuring they align with broader marketing goals and community engagement strategies.

Community Engagement & Growth:

Create and implement strategies to boost engagement with the existing community, with a focus on fostering loyalty and leveraging it to acquire new players.Monitor community trends and behavior to adapt marketing tactics for optimal engagement and player retention.

Reporting & Analysis:

Regularly track and analyze the performance of marketing campaigns, influencer partnerships, and community engagement strategies.Provide detailed reports to stakeholders, highlighting key insights and recommendations for future marketing efforts.

Requirements

Experience:

3+ years of experience in marketing or player acquisition within the gaming industry, preferably in a UGC-driven environment.Proven track record of managing successful digital marketing campaigns across multiple platforms.Experience working with influencers and content creators, including contract negotiation and performance analysis.

Skills:

Strong understanding of player acquisition strategies, both organic and paid, with a creative approach to campaign execution.Excellent communication and negotiation skills, particularly with influencers and external partners.Proficiency in performance tracking tools and analytics software.

Preferred:

Experience working in the UGC or gaming industry with a focus on community-driven content.Knowledge of current trends in social media marketing and influencer strategies.

jobs.title: Product & Marketing Lead
jobs.description:
At CulturePulse, we are at the forefront of leveraging AI to transform complex decision-making processes. Our flagship AI technology, ARES, is engineered to revolutionize how diverse sectors approach critical business and research challenges. CulturePulse’s simulations are used by organizations to inform policy, counter misinformation, and design technology with societal impact.
Job OverviewPassionate about both product strategy and growth? We’re looking for a Product & Marketing Lead to drive product discovery, manage agile delivery, and lead top-of-funnel customer acquisition across our B2B and B2G markets.
In this role, you’ll work closely with our founders and engineers to shape the product roadmap, drive lean sprints, and craft outreach strategies that attract and convert high-quality leads.
What you will do:Lead product discovery, validation, and prototyping.Manage product sprints, retrospectives, and backlog prioritisation.Design, test, and implement inbound and outbound lead generation strategies.Build targeted campaigns via email, LinkedIn, events, and partnerships.Collaborate with marketing and sales to optimise lead nurturing, conversion, and create impactful sales assets.Champion a lean, iterative development process aligned with organisational goals.
What you will bring:Proven product management experience (discovery through delivery).Experience in B2B/B2G lead generation, digital outreach, and relationship-based growth.Excellent communication and organisational skills.A growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to work autonomously.
Nice to have:B2B/B2G lead generation expertise (digital + relationship-driven)Experience in growth, BD, or partnerships alongside product leadershipKnowledge of public sector procurement/sales cycles (UK, EU, NATO)Background in UX/UI designFamiliarity with product architecture & software development
What we offer:You’ll be part of a mission-driven team building technology with real societal impact. Working across government, private sector, and non-profit partners, you’ll gain exposure to diverse challenges while shaping products that matter. We offer the freedom of a fully remote role, the energy of an early-stage environment, and the opportunity to collaborate with smart, purpose-driven colleagues.
If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Consultant.e SMA & SEA - CDI
jobs.description:
Descriptif du poste
Actuellement en forte croissance, nous cherchons à renforcer nos équipes ! Nous cherchons un.e consultant.e SMA & SEA avec une prédominance SMA.
En partenariat avec notre head of Paid Performance, vous aurez la charge d’un portefeuille clients sur la gestion et la mise en place de campagnes SEA et SMA (Meta, TikTok, LinkedIn, X...). Les missions seront les suivantes :Gestion de clientèle : vous êtes le garant de la bonne relation client et du respect de la qualité. Gestion et organisation de points réguliers avec les clientsGestion de projet : s’assurer du bon déroulement du projet en créant une synergie entre les partenaires de l’agence et les besoins du client. Envoie des dashboards Looker Studio prévus pour le client.Stratégie & Créa : définitions de stratégie SMA et SEA au service d’idées innovantes (stratégie enchères, scripts, flux automatisés, formats creatifs les plus adaptés...) et des principaux piliers : data analyse, automatisation, Audience, Automation, crea / éditorial et structure. jobs.title: Traffic Manager
jobs.description:
A propos
Kinomap est une entreprise 100% #SportTech, leader mondial de la vidéo géolocalisée pour l’entraînement indoor. Notre application permet aux utilisateurs de s’entraîner en immersion, depuis chez eux, sur des milliers de vidéos de parcours filmés en conditions réelles. Avec plus de 2 millions de membres dans 200 pays, nous connaissons une forte croissance en France et à l’international.
Description de posteTu rejoins l’équipe marketing avec une vraie mission : piloter nos leviers d’acquisition et optimiser la performance de nos offres et parcours. Un rôle stratégique, très opérationnel, et orienté résultats.
MissionsAcquisition & performance· Gérer les campagnes paid : brief créa, paramétrage, suivi· Analyser les KPIs et identifier des leviers d’optimisation· Garantir la fiabilité du tracking avec les équipes techniques ou les outils· Produire un reporting régulier et structuré des actions d’acquisitionParcours & conversion· Optimiser les parcours utilisateurs (onboarding, funnels, paywalls…)· Tester, segmenter et personnaliser avec des outils comme Purchasely ou Batch· Concevoir des promotions, les activer et en tirer les bilansCanaux organiques· Déployer notre stratégie SEO et gérer les partenariats d’affiliation· Optimiser notre référencement sur les stores Apple/Google (ASO) et être l’interlocuteur privilégié d’Apple/Google pour le suivi de nos stores
Profil· Tu as entre 2 et 5 ans d’expérience en marketing d’acquisition ou en performance digitale· Tu maîtrises les leviers paid (Meta, Google Ads, Apple search Ads…) et tu as une bonne compréhension du tracking et de l’attribution· Tu es à l’aise avec les chiffres, orienté·e performance, et autonome dans la gestion de tes projets· Tu sais piloter des actions de bout en bout· Tu as un bon relationnel et tu t’adaptes facilement à des interlocuteurs variés (tech, data, produit, partenaires)· Tu as un bon niveau d’anglais
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?· Un poste à fort impact, mêlant stratégie, exécution et vision produit· Une équipe bienveillante· Un produit unique et international, au cœur de la #SportTech· Une croissance rapide, avec plein de sujets à faire avancer· 2 jours de télétravail par semaine
Tu te reconnais dans cette annonce ? Envoie-nous ta candidature, on a hâte d’en discuter avec toi ! Contacte nous jobs@kinomap.com

jobs.title: Chef de projet digital F/H
jobs.description:
Au sein de la Direction des systèmes d’information (DSI) et sous l’autorité de la Responsable du Département Outils Digitaux, la mission principale est d'assurer la conception et le développement technico-fonctionnels des services/produits en lien avec la feuille de route marketing et Communication dans le cadre des orientations stratégiques de l'entreprise jusqu'à la mise en production.

A ce titre, le(la) chef(fe) de projet intervient sur l’écosystème digital lié à la relation donneur composé de plusieurs sites web, d’une application mobile et de services transverses (chatbot, API) ainsi que sur l’ecosystème de communication institutionnelle.

Le(la) chef(fe) de projet garantit les conditions de passage en exploitation des services/produits dont il(elle) aura la responsabilité et assure le suivi des évolutions/corrections dans une logique de gestion du cycle de vie technique des services/produits.

Ses missions seront les suivantes:

Piloter des projets ou parties de projets de mise en œuvre technique sur les solutions existantes et nouvelles;Animer les comités projets et réunions de travail ;Co-construire la Roadmap des services/produits avec les métiers et travailler à sa mise en œuvre;Identifier les améliorations fonctionnelles avec les équipes métiers contributives de la qualité de service;Mettre en place et suivre le reporting projet : avancement, risques, plan d’actions, budget;Valider la faisabilité technique et la cohérence des solutions déployées et/ou développements vis-à-vis du SI existant;Assurer la priorisation et le suivi des développements, la coordination des ressources et des moyens affectés à la production/maintenance des services/produits et garantir le respect du calendrier et la qualité en lien avec les équipes de développement;Coordonner les prestations externes;Contrôler le respect des exigences de sécurité, RGPD et RGAA;Valider et maintenir à jour la documentation technique du projet (spécifications, DAT, cahier de recette,…);Organiser et participer à la recette technique et fonctionnelle des outils;Assurer le suivi des corrections des incidents selon leur nature;Faire le lien avec les services de production interne et externe;Participer au support technique des services; Veille technologique et sourcing de nouveaux outils;Gestion de l’Homologation (sécurité, RGPD, RGAA) des outils dont il(elle) a la charge.

Formation supérieure en informatique1ère expérience souhaitée en conduite de projets digitaux.Idéalement une expérience de développement informatiqueMaîtrise de la gestion de projets informatiques (Cycle en V, projets Agiles…).Vision projet fortement centrée sur l’utilisateur.Capacité d’analyse, autonomie et forte aptitude à travailler en équipe (direction, équipes métier, consultants fonctionnels et techniques, équipe support…)

jobs.title: User Acquisition Manager (Appsflyer)
jobs.description:
About the Role:We're looking for a results-driven User Acquisition Manager with hands-on experience in mobile marketing, app attribution, and analytics platforms like AppsFlyer. You will play a key role in scaling user acquisition, optimizing ad spend, and improving retention through data-driven campaigns and deep insights into user behavior.
🔍 Responsibilities:Develop and execute user acquisition campaigns for mobile apps across paid channels (Meta, Google, TikTok, etc.)Set up, manage, and optimize attribution tracking via AppsFlyerAnalyze marketing performance using mobile attribution and analytics tools to improve ROI and LTVCollaborate with product and design teams to enhance mobile funnel and conversion strategiesOwn reporting dashboards, KPIs, and performance metricsManage app store optimization (ASO) effortsKeep up with trends in mobile marketing, privacy, and ad tech (e.g., SKAN, GAID/IDFA changes)
✅ Requirements:3+ years of experience in mobile marketing or performance marketingProven expertise with AppsFlyer (or similar tools like Adjust, Branch, Kochava)Strong analytical skills and familiarity with tools like Google Analytics, Looker, or TableauExperience with A/B testing and conversion rate optimizationExcellent communication and cross-functional collaboration skillsBonus: Experience with mobile gaming, fintech, or e-commerce apps
💡 What We Offer:Competitive salary and performance-based bonusesAccess to cutting-edge tools and platformsOpportunity to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environmentFlexible working model and supportive team culture

jobs.title: Marketing & External Communication Manager
jobs.description:
Marketing & External Communication Manager
ABOUT Dylogy📍 Location: Lyon, France (Hybrid / Partial Remote – EU only)🌐 Company: At Dylogy, we’re not just another tech company. We’re on the cusp of changing the (re)insurance market with our groundbreaking Risk monitoring AI platform. If you’re a change-maker, passionate about AI, and eager to reshape the way insurance works, you’re the candidate we’ve been searching for

JOB DETAILS🕒 Contract: Permanent (CDI) – Full-time🔗 Reports to: CEO (close collaboration with Product & Sales leadership)🌍 Role: Marketing & External Communication Manager💰 Salary: 55-65K€

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Marketing (60%)o Product Marketing & Positioning: Define Dylogy’s value proposition, personas, and use cases. Craft compelling product narratives for new features and solutions.o Go-to-Market Strategy: Build and execute launch plans, lead generation campaigns, and marketing playbooks aligned with sales objectives.o Digital Marketing & Automation:§ Own and optimize Dylogy’s website (analytics, conversion tracking).§ Deploy marketing automation (Hubspot).§ Manage targeted email campaigns, nurture flows, and lead scoring.o Sales Enablement: Provide high-quality marketing collateral (decks, one-pagers, case studies). Collaborate with sales teams to align messaging and accelerate deal cycles.
External Communication (30%)o Content Creation & Brand Voice: Produce engaging and consistent content (articles, brochures, white papers, thought-leadership pieces, product videos).o Digital & Social Media: Lead Dylogy’s online presence across LinkedIn, X, YouTube, etc. Manage editorial calendar and community engagement.o Events & Industry Presence: Coordinate Dylogy’s participation in major industry conferences, webinars, and partner events.o Thought Leadership: Position Dylogy as a trusted voice in AI, insurance, and risk monitoring through speaking opportunities, publications, and strategic content.o Generative AI Tools: Leverage cutting-edge tools (ChatGPT, MidJourney, etc.) to accelerate content creation and enhance creativity.
Press & Professional Networks (10%)o Build and maintain relationships with journalists, analysts, and key industry influencers.o Draft and distribute press releases, media kits, and announcements.o Represent Dylogy within professional networks, associations, and forums.

QUALIFICATIONS
Experience & Skillso 7–10+ years in B2B marketing & external communication, ideally in Tech, SaaS, or Insurance.o Proven track record as a Marketing Manager or Head of Marketing.o Hands-on expertise with modern marketing stacks: Hubspot, Canva, Notion, Figma, etc.o Strong understanding of digital strategies (growth marketing, inbound).o Exposure to AI and Generative AI tools for content, automation, and market intelligence.o Experience in startup or scale-up environments, able to thrive in a fast-moving ecosystem.
Soft Skillso Highly dynamic, delivery-driven, and impact-orientedo Strong communicator with storytelling ability and sharp editorial sense.o Tech-savvy and curious about new tools, automation, and AI innovations.o Structured and process-oriented, with a mindset for scalability.o Collaborative leadership style, able to work cross-functionally with Sales, Product, and Tech.
Languageso Fluent French.o Professional English.
 WHY DYLOGY
· Be part of a mission-driven team disrupting the (re)insurance market with AI.· Work in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment with strong appetite for R&D.· Collaborate with passionate people who value excellence, creativity, and impact.· Accelerated growth opportunities and direct exposure to leadership.  RECRUITMENT PROCESS
· 📞 Introductory call (30 min)· 👥 HR interview (1h)· 🎯 Marketing case study & presentation (1h)· 🤝 Final interview with leadership (1h)

jobs.title: Ecommerce Account Manager(A46233)
jobs.description:
Responsibilities:Sales Performance Management : Oversee and enhance online sales performance by optimizing product listings, pricing, and inventory to boost overall digital business performance.Ecommerce Project Management : Manage projects related to ecommerce, including but not limited to sales, performance marketing, CRM and product launches.Advertising and Marketing Optimization : Manage and refine online advertising strategies to boost key performance indicators such as traffic and conversion rates.Business Analysis and Growth : Conduct regular business reviews to analyze sales performance and identify potential areas for growth and expansion on ecommerce platforms.Cross-functional Collaboration : Collaborate with GTM, marketing, and logistics teams to ensure seamless and efficient operations.Industry Trend Monitoring : Stay updated on industry trends, ecommerce technologies, and best practices to ensure our platforms remain competitive and innovative.

jobs.title: Consultant, Digital Strategy
jobs.description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Practice Area

BCG’s Tech and Digital practice area focuses on helping clients deliver competitive advantage and business superior performance through the use of data, technology and digital. Tech and Digital is the fastest growing practice at BCG and at the heart of the strategic impact we have with our clients. Our consultants and experts globally work across all industries and provide deep experience and expertise across a number of topics including Digital Transformation, Data & Digital Platforms, AI at Scale, Agile, Cybersecurity and Digitizing the Tech Function. Our Tech and Digital offer encompasses tech experts across BCG and Platinion, providing seamless multidisciplinary solutions to our clients.

What You'll Do

Our world is being driven by digital and at BCG we are at the heart of it. In DigitalBCG, you would use your expertise and generalist consulting skillset to help CEOs and their teams solve their most pressing challenges, and think about how digital and technology will change the shape of their business.You would help your clients answer questions such as 'How will AI disrupt my business model?', 'How can businesses use data and analytics to create highly-personalized outreach delivered through a seamless omnichannel experience?', 'How can I ship higher quality digital services to my customers faster by using agile?' and much more.As a member of our team, you would work on a variety of these topics, applying your consulting skills to strategic digital, technology, and digital transformation questions.As a DigitalBCG Consultant, you will be given end-to-end responsibility for the larger and more complex 'modules' within a BCG project, and begin to develop specialized knowledge to help you solve our clients' problems. You'll work closely with clients to understand their issues, create strategies for change, win buy-in for your recommendations, and collaborate with fellow BCGers to transform client potential into performance.A broad skillset and passion for digital & technology is important. As part of our digitally-focused consulting team, you would work on a variety of digital topics, applying generalist consulting skills to strategic digital & technology questions. You will be supported by an extensive training curriculum (the same programme as all BCG consultants), plus digital-specific training and mentoring to help you build your skills.

What You'll Bring

We're looking for exceptional talent from consulting or industry to join us. You would typically:

Have 4-6 years' of experience working:with a leading consulting firm (focused on technology/digital initiatives)in a corporate role focused on technology/digital initiatives (e.g. business analyst)in a tech start-up leadership role or in a 'consulting-like' industry (e.g. digital strategy, digital marketing)Have an outstanding academic track record from a leading universityHave excellent verbal and written communication skills in English

description.text:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Practice Area

BCG’s Tech and Digital practice area focuses on helping clients deliver competitive advantage and business superior performance through the use of data, technology and digital. Tech and Digital is the fastest growing practice at BCG and at the heart of the strategic impact we have with our clients. Our consultants and experts globally work across all industries and provide deep experience and expertise across a number of topics including Digital Transformation, Data & Digital Platforms, AI at Scale, Agile, Cybersecurity and Digitizing the Tech Function. Our Tech and Digital offer encompasses tech experts across BCG and Platinion, providing seamless multidisciplinary solutions to our clients.

What You'll Do

Our world is being driven by digital and at BCG we are at the heart of it. In DigitalBCG, you would use your expertise and generalist consulting skillset to help CEOs and their teams solve their most pressing challenges, and think about how digital and technology will change the shape of their business.You would help your clients answer questions such as 'How will AI disrupt my business model?', 'How can businesses use data and analytics to create highly-personalized outreach delivered through a seamless omnichannel experience?', 'How can I ship higher quality digital services to my customers faster by using agile?' and much more.As a member of our team, you would work on a variety of these topics, applying your consulting skills to strategic digital, technology, and digital transformation questions.As a DigitalBCG Consultant, you will be given end-to-end responsibility for the larger and more complex 'modules' within a BCG project, and begin to develop specialized knowledge to help you solve our clients' problems. You'll work closely with clients to understand their issues, create strategies for change, win buy-in for your recommendations, and collaborate with fellow BCGers to transform client potential into performance.A broad skillset and passion for digital & technology is important. As part of our digitally-focused consulting team, you would work on a variety of digital topics, applying generalist consulting skills to strategic digital & technology questions. You will be supported by an extensive training curriculum (the same programme as all BCG consultants), plus digital-specific training and mentoring to help you build your skills.

What You'll Bring

We're looking for exceptional talent from consulting or industry to join us. You would typically:

Have 4-6 years' of experience working:with a leading consulting firm (focused on technology/digital initiatives)in a corporate role focused on technology/digital initiatives (e.g. business analyst)in a tech start-up leadership role or in a 'consulting-like' industry (e.g. digital strategy, digital marketing)Have an outstanding academic track record from a leading universityHave excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Who You'll Work With

Who You'll Work With:Our consultants within DigitalBCG are an integral part of BCG's core consulting team; we work side-by-side with all practice areas to create value & competitive advantage for our clients

jobs.title: Acheteur Electronique expérimenté (consultant indépendant)
jobs.description:
Description de l'entreprise : EverEver est une jeune entreprise industrielle en phase d'industrialisation de son premier produit : Albert, un lave-vaisselle conçu pour durer plus de 20 ans, évolutif dans le temps, éco-conçu et fabriqué localement. Nous sommes une équipe de 9 experts et ingénieurs, situés à Paris. L'usine d'assemblage de notre produit sera situé à Vannes. EverEver est lauréat de l'Aide Première Usine de France 2030 et a déjà levé plus de 1,8M€ auprès d'investisseurs privés.
Description du poste Nous recherchons un.e Acheteur.euse Electronique Expérimenté.e en tant que consultant.e indépendant.e pour une mission ponctuelle pour aider l'équipe à sélectionner et contractualiser notre EMS et nos distributeurs de composants. Vous serez responsable de la gestion et de l'optimisation des achats de composants électroniques. Vos tâches incluront l'évaluation des EMS et des distributeurs, les demandes de prix, la négociation des contrats et l'assurance de l'approvisionnement en composants de haute qualité. Ce travail se fera en collaboration étroite avec le responsable industrialisation et notre expert technique et représentera quelques heures à 1,5 jours par semaine de travail. De manière occasionnelle, il y aura des besoins de visite de certains EMS et de réaliser des rdv physiques auprès des EMS et distributeurs, principalement basé en France.
Qualifications : Compétences en Évaluation des Fournisseurs : Expérience dans l'évaluation et la sélection des fournisseurs pour garantir la qualité, les délais, les prix.Analyse du coût total (TCO) : prix d’achat, transport, douanes, stockage, taux de change.Connaissance des modèles contractuels : NDA, contrats d’approvisionnement, clauses de pénalité/délai, qualité.Suivi budgétaire et reporting achats.Compétences en Processus d'Achats : Maîtrise des processus d'achats y compris la négociation et la rédaction des principales clauses, et le suivi des contrats avec EMS et distributeurs.Expertise dans l'achat et l'approvisionnement de composants électroniques et en gestion des risques d'approvisionnement,Connaissance des composants électroniques : semi-conducteurs, capteurs, cartes, connecteurs, alimentations, modules RF, etc.Lecture de nomenclatures (BOM) et de schémas électroniques pour comprendre les besoins exacts de l’ingénierie.Compréhension des standards et normes (RoHS, REACH, CE, UL, IPC, etc.).Veille technologique : anticiper les obsolescences, évolutions de gamme, roadmap des fabricants.

jobs.title: Technical SEO Manager - relocation to Cyprus
jobs.description:
We are looking for a highly skilled SEO Expert with proven experience in the iGaming industry to join our team. This role requires deep technical expertise, a strong understanding of complex web environments, and a track record of driving measurable organic growth. The ideal candidate will combine hands-on technical SEO knowledge with the ability to create clear implementation roadmaps for development teams.
This is an on-site in Limassol. We will be happy to relocate you!
Key Responsibilities:Lead SEO strategy and execution for iGaming products across multiple marketsConduct ongoing technical SEO audits, identifying issues and delivering clear, actionable instructions to development teamsManage SEO optimization for JavaScript-based websites, including working with prerender service to ensure proper crawlability and indexationDevelop and oversee site speed optimization initiatives, providing precise recommendations to developersPlan and manage complex site migration projects to protect and enhance search engine visibilityDefine and maintain a long-term SEO roadmap for web products, ensuring sustainable organic growth and visibilityTrack performance, analyze data, and report insights using tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Ahrefs, SEMrush, and Screaming FrogStay ahead of search engine algorithm changes and emerging AI-driven search and AI agent optimization trendsCollaborate closely with product, content, and developer teams to ensure SEO is embedded into all stages of development
Requirements:4+ years SEO experience within the iGaming industry (mandatory)Strong expertise in JavaScript SEO and handling websites that rely on client-side renderingHands-on experience with prerender service and dynamic rendering solutionsProven ability to run ongoing technical audits and translate findings into clear developer instructionsDemonstrated experience improving site performance and speed through structured collaboration with developersTrack record of successfully handling complex website migrations with minimal loss of visibilityStrong knowledge of search engine algorithms, ranking factors, and modern SEO best practicesProven success in optimizing for AI agents and preparing websites for emerging search technologiesiProficiency with SEO tools: Google Analytics, GSC, Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz, Screaming Frog, etsSolid understanding of HTML, CSS, and CMS platformsExcellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly document SEO requirements and roadmaps for non-SEO stakeholders

jobs.title: Content Writer
jobs.description:
Innodata (NASDAQ: INOD) is a leading data engineering company. With more than 2,000 customers and operations in 13 cities around the world, we are an AI technology solutions provider-of-choice for 4 out of 5 of the world’s biggest technology companies, as well as leading companies across financial services, insurance, technology, law, and medicine.By combining advanced machine learning and artificial intelligence (ML/AI) technologies, a global workforce of subject matter experts, and a high-security infrastructure, we’re helping usher in the promise of AI. Innodata offers a powerful combination of both digital data solutions and easy-to-use, high-quality platforms.
Our global workforce includes over 5,000 employees in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, the Philippines, India, Sri Lanka, Israel and Germany.
About the role:
We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented linguist to support AI training initiatives and linguistic content creation. This role is ideal for someone with a strong academic background in linguistics (syntax, semantics, pragmatics, morphology, phonology, sociolinguistics, etc.) and a passion for language, technology, and clear communication. You will play a crucial role in shaping the capabilities of large language models (LLMs) and NLP-based systems through high-quality linguistic data curation, annotation, and evaluation.
Job Title: Linguistics Expert – AI Training & Content Writing

Key Responsibilities:
Create or edit linguistically- rich content including grammar guides, syntactic analyses, usage explanations, or examples for NLP pipelines.Identify and resolve issues related to ambiguity, bias, and grammaticality.Perform quality assurance (QA) on model outputs for fluency, tone, factual accuracy, and language appropriateness.Annotate linguistic datasets with syntactic, semantic, or pragmatic labels.Support internal teams by conducting linguistic research and summarizing findings.Apply linguistic knowledge to evaluate model behavior, error patterns, and generalization issues.
Qualifications:Deep understanding of linguistic theory and language structure.Experience with one or more of the following is a plus: computational linguistics, corpus analysis, language data annotation, LLM training.Strong writing, editing, and communication skills.
Next StepsTo proceed further in the evaluation process, you will need to complete two assessments:Assessment TestEvaluates your linguistic and analytical skillsLink: https://icap.innodata.com/registerfreelancer?enc=oUTZVsr/Pnz/0Xygc2EK32MdtinqnjC9vy8RU3Ha4EOAPwT2LJJQDD68MkY6jszYhhsYYecqmKWja8eKXV801gezikielezikiel

Versant English Proficiency TestFocuses on assessing your spoken and written English proficiencyA C1 or C2 level is required to qualify
Once both assessments are successfully completed, you will be eligible for onboarding.Arabic Language test
Action Required: XConnect RegistrationYou will also receive an invitation to our internal job platform, XConnect. Please take a few minutes to register and complete your profile. All project onboarding, communication, and documentation are managed through this platform.
If interested, kindly share your resume at: rranjan2@innodata.com

jobs.title: Responsable CRM
jobs.description:
Lieu : Télétravail / Bureau (Nice)Type de contrat : Stage rémunéré ou FreelanceDisponibilité : Dès que possible
PYRAMID est une agence CRM & marketing basée à Nice, experte en Email, SMS & WhatsApp. On marie créativité et performance pour des marques e-commerce, apps et logiciels sans idées génériques ni templates recyclés. Chaque campagne doit avoir une accroche forte, un angle distinctif et une intention claire. Tu collaboreras au quotidien avec notre Email Creative Lab pour transformer la stratégie en expériences qui marquent.
Au sein du Lab, tu seras en charge de :
Tu es le(a) chef d’orchestre : tu assures l’exécution, la relation client et la performance du kick-off aux résultats.
🚀 Onboarding clientAssurer une intégration fluide (infos, accès, brief clair).Mettre en place les bons rituels de suivi (Slack/WhatsApp, calendrier).
💬 Gestion & relation clientCoordonner les livrables (contenu, design, intégration).Tenir le calendrier des campagnes et animer un point hebdo rapide.
📊 Performance & stratégieSuivre les KPIs clés et créer les reportingsPréparer des rapports clairs et proposer des optimisations.Prioriser et suivre les tests (angles, séquences, ciblages).
👥 Coordination d’équipeBriefer et piloter CRM Managers & designers.Organiser les weekly internes et résoudre les blocages.Contribuer aux recrutements et à la montée en compétences.
Tu es fait·e pour ce poste si :Tu gères plusieurs projets sans perdre la qualité. Tu sais relier idées, exécution et impact business.Tu lis les chiffres pour décider vite et bien.Tu as une forte maîtrise de Klaviyo (ou forte envie d’apprendre vite).Bonus : bonne culture web/tendances et aisance à pitcher des concepts quand il faut.

jobs.title: Operations Specialist – Marketplace
jobs.description:
We’re looking for an analytical and solutions-driven Operations Specialist with excellent leadership and interpersonal skills to help us grow our ride-hailing operations in France. The Operations Specialist will play a pivotal role within the Marketplace Team at Bolt, supporting various aspects of our marketplace operations.

Please note that this is a full-time permanent employment opportunity.

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 100 million customers in 45+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

As an Operations Specialist you will have a direct and tangible impact on local operations that you can see in real-time. If you’re ready to take full ownership of your work, disrupt the marketplace, and shape movement patterns in the urban landscape - here’s your chance!

You will be leading local operations projects and working closely with other cross-functional/HQ stakeholders to support our mission to make cities more sustainable, accessible and affordable.

Your daily adventures will include:

Conducting performance audits across our marketplace in various cities.Formulating actionable recommendations to enhance marketplace performance.Analyzing pricing strategies and suggesting price adjustments as needed.Collaborating closely with central teams to implement demand and supply campaigns effectively.Providing analytical and data support to city managers to facilitate informed decision-making..


About you:

Strong analytical skills paired with a relentless curiosity, willing to delve deep into data to identify root causes.You are a strong leader and collaborator with excellent negotiation and communication skills (both verbal and written) in English and French.Organized and methodical approach to problem-solving within our marketplace.Pragmatic mindset, prioritizing effective solutions over unnecessarily complex ones.Collaborative team player, capable of working efficiently with diverse stakeholders.Proficiency in SQL and automation is a big plus.


Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility. Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries. Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world. Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities. Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work. Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode. Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks. Some perks may differ depending on your location.

jobs.title: Growth Marketing Specialist
jobs.description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilitiesOwn. Take full ownership of your product’s marketing strategy. You’ll lead user acquisition end-to-end, from setting goals to launching campaigns and scaling what works to maximize performance.Create. Generate new ad concepts and out-of-the-box growth-hacking ideas, formulate testable hypotheses, coordinate implementation across channels like Google, Meta, and TikTok, and provide sharp feedback to continuously raise the bar.Analyze. Monitor performance through BI dashboards and campaign data. Ensure acquisition efforts achieve target KPIs, and turn insights into bold, data-driven decisions that fuel growth.Collaborate. Work closely with the product team to understand user motivations and help shape monetization and growth strategies that align with user behavior and long-term success.

What we look forReasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offerIncredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They’re challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities—just let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you’ve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.

description.text:

A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.

jobs.title: Marketing Manager (Crypto)
jobs.description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

If Revolut is a rocket ship — and we like to think it is — best-in-class creativity is what propels us past the competition in the eyes of our customers. Working with Marketing, Product, Analytics, and just about any other team you can think of, our superstar Marketing Managers lead the development of jaw-dropping content and campaign strategies that demonstrate how beneficial Revolut is to millions of people.

We're looking for a #GetItDone creative genius to join the team and take the lead on bringing our #NeverSettle propositions to market as a Marketing Manager for Crypto. You'll have an exciting opportunity to work closely with the local management team as well as the global function lead to drive growth in the market.

Up for the challenge? Let‘s get in touch.

What You'll Be Doing

Identifying customer needs by understanding their behaviour and how our features work globally to create data-driven content to drive conversionDriving independently impactful go-to-market product launches by owning development of audience strategy, messaging, and communication strategiesDeveloping research plans to uncover customer insights, steer and validate product and marketing roadmaps, and stay on top of the competitive landscapeCreating market-leading campaign calendars designed to drive engagement across the entire funnel, from acquisition to retentionOwning tone of voice and style guides, adapting global campaigns aligned to local nuancesRunning experiments to test hypotheses and bring analytical rigour to campaigns for informing the go-to-market strategyDelivering campaigns with a solid bias for growth and business impactScaling creative marketing efforts globally by operationalising resources, such as playbooks for regional marketing teams

What You'll Need

Fluency in English (native level)5+ years of B2C marketing experience in a fast-paced environment (preferably a hyper-growth global tech company)Interest in the Crypto industryExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsPassion for Revolut’s products and featuresKnowledge of markets and the competitive landscape in the fintech or payments industryExtensive experience developing stories and compelling content to drive conversionExperience setting strategic direction and project managing complex campaigns that require input and execution from cross-functional teamsAn impressive track record of planning and creating editorial and commercial contentThe ability to analyse and distil data into actionable insights and to inform campaign strategy and product developmentTo be a charismatic people-person with the ability to talk to anyone and work in an evolving, growth environment

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

jobs.title: Brand & Communications Manager - Fintech H/F
jobs.description:
Upward, cabinet de recrutement par approche directe, recherche pour l’un de ses clients, fintech française en forte croissance, un(e) Brand & Communications Manager H/F.
Poste : Brand & Communications ManagerLieu : Paris
L’entrepriseNotre client est une fintech premium, reconnue comme l’une des références de son marché.
Sa mission : réinventer la gestion de patrimoine haut de gamme grâce à une approche digitale unique, alliant expertise, technologie et diversification. Son offre intègre un large éventail de solutions financières et de placements alternatifs, accessibles depuis une interface 100 % en ligne.
Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le rayonnement de la marque. Vous serez chargé(e) de renforcer sa visibilité et son positionnement premium en pilotant l’ensemble des actions de communication externe et l’organisation d’événements stratégiques.
Véritable interface entre les fondateurs, l’équipe marketing et les partenaires médias, vous interviendrez sur un périmètre mêlant relations presse, réseaux sociaux, contenus et événements, avec un objectif clair : incarner et valoriser l’expertise unique de la marque auprès de ses publics cibles.
Missions principales
Social Media-Pilotage stratégique & opérationnel des réseaux comme LinkedIn (structuration, ligne éditoriale, suivi des performances)
Webinars-Organisation de 2 webinars/mois (contenu, intervenants, logistique, diffusion)
Événementiel-Lancement et pérennisation des événements physiques (clients & partenaires)-Développement de formats premium pour incarner la marque
Positionnement & Image-Suivi des initiatives RP/presse et partenariats de visibilité-Développement de nouveaux canaux (ex. YouTube)-Production de contenus pour le site vitrine et cohérence éditoriale globale
Profil recherché-1 à 3 ans d'expérience sur un poste similaire dans un environnement financier (ou expertise pour le secteur)-Excellentes compétences rédactionnelles, capable d’adapter le ton selon la cible (journalistes, partenaires, clients…)-Capacité à gérer plusieurs sujets en parallèle, avec rigueur et rapidité-Aisance à dialoguer avec des interlocuteurs de haut niveau (BlackRock, Rothschild, etc.)-Appétence pour les sujets d’investissement
Sur ce poste, votre expertise en finance (ETF, Actions, Obligations, SCPI...) sera un élément clé. 
PackageFixe : ~50K€ + BSPCE + avantages

jobs.title: Global senior Social Media Manager - BeReal
jobs.description:
About BeReal

At BeReal, we are dedicated to authenticity in social media. By encouraging users to share unfiltered moments, we foster genuine connections and celebrate real life. We are now an international team of 70+ and have 40M+ monthly active users. Backed by Voodoo, our team is fully focused on scaling BeReal into an iconic social network used by hundreds of millions.

Role

We’re looking for a creative, independent, and strategic Senior Social Media Manager to reactivate and reinvent BeReal’s presence on all global social platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and yes — even BeReal itself.

You’ll own BeReal’s voice across platforms, rekindle engagement with our millions of followers, and create content that feels human, on trend, and on brand. From lo-fi check-ins to thumb-stopping creative to strategic collabs, you’ll help shape what BeReal means to this next generation — especially as we expand into monetization.

Lead BeReal’s owned social media presence across TikTok, Instagram, and BeReal, with the potential to expand to emerging platformsReignite community engagement with creative, raw, and resonant content that reflects BeReal’s values: authenticity, mental health, and presenceDesign and own the content calendar, from planned storytelling to real-time reactive postsShape the voice and tone of BeReal across all platforms, reinforcing our distinct POV in the social landscapeCollaborate with our community to elevate user stories and content (UGC), and amplify our most passionate voicesPartner with the Brand Strategy team to roll out campaigns that support growth, brand trust, and cultural relevance — particularly as we introduce adsTrack and analyze performance to inform strategy and optimize for engagement, reach, and resonanceEnsure alignment with overall brand strategy and comms priorities

Profile

5+ years experience managing social media for a youth-focused, culture-first brand or platform on a global scale (ideally EMEA + USA)Deep understanding of Gen Z behavior, trends, memes, and what it takes to earn attention (and trust)Strong creative instincts and impeccable taste — you know what feels right, and what doesn’tProven ability to grow and engage large audiences across platformsConfidence to work autonomously and take creative risks, with a test-learn-optimize mindsetExcellent writing and visual storytelling skills (bonus if you can shoot/edit content too)Passionate about authenticity, mental health, and building a better version of social mediaParis based

jobs.title: Chef de projet E-commerce - Shopify
jobs.description:
Nous sommes à la recherche d'un nouveau talent au sein de notre équipe pour consolider notre portefeuille de marques.

Missions Principales

Responsable du développement du chiffre d’affaires e-commerce : analyse des résultats et mise en place de plan d’actionResponsable du relationnel avec les marquesMise en place et suivi des indicateurs de reporting (CA, taux de transformation, panier moyen...)Point de contact entre les différentes équipes et les clients (E-commerce, marketing, marketplaces, SAV)Suivi du déroulement des projets E-commerce, Marketing et Marketplaces (Zalando, La Redoute, Amazon) avec les équipes.

Profil Recherché

Minimum 2 ans d’expérience en CDI dans l'univers du e-commerce et idéalement de la mode.

Qualités Requises

Forte expérience dans la gestion d'un projet e-commerce (Shopify ou Prestashop). Aisance avec les chiffres et capacité d’analyse.Capacité à entretenir une relation de confiance avec les dirigeants ou fondateurs des marques partenaires.Profil agile, organisé, dynamique et tenace dans ses actions.Capacité à instaurer de nouveaux processus et à assurer le suivi de l'activité, ainsi qu'à faire évoluer les processus existants.Connaissances du domaine de l'e-commerce (Acquisition, Conversion, Marketplaces).Connaissance de l'univers du prêt-à-porter.Maîtrise de l'anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit.Esprit d’équipe et goût pour le challenge.

Poste à pourvoir dès maintenant à Paris (9ème), télétravail 2j par semaine.

jobs.title: Product Owner - Web
jobs.company: STRATIS | L’expert numérique du secteur public
jobs.description:
Stratis, l’expert numérique du secteur publicClassé dans le TOP 4 des prestataires numériques du secteur public (étude Acteurs Publics), Stratis accompagne la transformation digitale de l’action publique à toutes les échelles du territoire depuis 25 ans.En alliant l’ingénierie numérique de haut niveau et les sciences politiques, nous concevons des stratégies 360° (UX/UI, Écoconception, Accessibilité, IA, Cybersécurité…) et développons des solutions multicanales efficientes (sites internet, applications mobiles, intranet…) pour plus de 400 clients publics.Notre croissance est portée par un carnet de commandes solide, 160 collaborateurs passionnés et un fort investissement en R&D. Ministères, Régions, Métropoles et Collectivités nous font confiance pour relever leurs défis numériques.Notre culture d’entreprise repose sur l’expertise, la fiabilité et l’éthique.Nous offrons un parcours d’enrichissement continu, un management par la compétence et des conditions de travail privilégiées dans un cadre de vie exceptionnel, entre Provence et Côte d’Azur.
Le poste : Product Owner WebAu sein de notre pôle digital et sous la responsabilité du Chef de Département TMA, vous êtes le chef d’orchestre de la conception et de l’évolution de nos produits numériques.En tant que porteur de la vision produit, vous agissez comme le lien stratégique entre les attentes de nos clients publics et nos équipes de développement.Votre objectif : maximiser la valeur métier livrée et garantir la création de solutions performantes et innovantes.Votre connaissance, en qualité de Product Owner, d’un ou plusieurs CMS comme WordPress, Drupal ou Joomla est indispensable.
Vos missions clésDéfinir et porter la vision du produit : construire une feuille de route claire, identifier les opportunités et communiquer les objectifs aux équipes et aux parties prenantes, en lien avec chaque Chef de Projet Numérique.Construire et prioriser le Product Backlog : transformer les besoins et les retours utilisateurs en une to-do-list de fonctionnalités, hiérarchisée selon la valeur métier, l’effort et le risque.Rédiger les User Stories : Traduire les exigences en récits utilisateurs clairs, précis et exploitables par l’équipe de développement pour assurer une parfaite compréhension du besoin.Piloter le développement agile : Animer les rituels (sprint planning, review, etc.), collaborer au quotidien avec les développeurs et les UX designers pour lever les obstacles et accélérer les phases de développement.Valider la production : Être le seul décisionnaire pour accepter ou rejeter les fonctionnalités développées , en s’assurant qu’elles répondent parfaitement aux critères d’acceptation.Être l’interlocuteur privilégié : Assurer une communication fluide entre les clients, les sponsors et l’équipe technique pour garantir l’alignement de tous et le succès du produit.
Votre profilNous recherchons un leader passionné par le web dans toutes ses dimensions, doté d’une vision stratégique, d’un excellent sens de la collaboration et d’une forte appétence pour les technologies web, l’innovation, les nouveaux usages, l’expérience utilisateur, l’IA, la relation client…
Vous disposez d’une formation initiale en management de projet numérique (IT, web, Application…), validée à minima par un Master.Vous justifiez d’une expérience confirmée en tant que Product Owner, idéalement acquise en agence, ESN ou chez un éditeur de logiciel.Votre maîtrise des méthodes Agiles (Scrum, Kanban) est avérée et vous savez en diffuser les principes et la valeur au sein des équipes.Doté d’une bonne culture technique, sans être un développeur, vous comprenez les enjeux de conception d’un site web, d’une application, mobile, d’un intranet ou d’une application métier.Vos qualités de communication, d’écoute et de négociation font de vous un interlocuteur crédible et apprécié, capable de prendre des décisions et de les défendre avec diplomatie.Très à l’aise à l’oral, vous maîtrisez parfaitement le français et êtes capable de soutenir une discussion en Anglais.Votre rigueur, votre esprit de synthèse et votre leadership naturel vous permettent de fédérer les équipes autour d’une vision commune et d’atteindre les objectifs.Votre savoir-être, essentiel à nos yeux, saura s’épanouir au sein d’une équipe soudée et solidaire.
Ce que nous vous offronsUn environnement de travail exceptionnel dans notre siège social de La Farlède (83), au cœur d’un écosystème dynamique.Une équipe soudée, expérimentée et solidaire, favorisant le partage de connaissances.Une formation interne assurée à nos métiers, nos outils et nos méthodes.De nombreux outils performants à votre disposition, incluant des solutions d’IA intégrées pour optimiser votre quotidien.La solidité d’une entreprise reconnue, vous permettant de vous projeter durablement.Si besoin, une assistance au déménagement et au logement
ModalitésContrat : CDI à temps plein.Lieu : poste basé à La Farlède (proche Toulon/Hyères), en présentiel. Pas de déplacements à prévoir.Rémunération : attractive, selon votre profil et votre expérience.Date de prise de poste : dès que possible, selon vos disponibilités.Adresser : CV, Niveau d'anglais, Lettre motivation, Date de prise de poste possible.

jobs.title: Programme Manager (French speaking)
jobs.description:
Job title: Programme Manager (SaaS - French Speaking)

Job type: Contract

Contract Length:12 months

Rate: €500+ per day (depending on experience)

Role Location: Must be based in the EU and be French speaking (remote working)

The company: A leading SaaS Fintech organisation based globally..

Role and Responsibilities: We are hiring for an experienced Programme Manager on a digital transformation programme for a SaaS fintech organisation looking to expand their product offering. We are looking for someone to engage with external customers to integrate products into business applications.

Job Requirements

8+ years Programme managment experience Strong internal and external stakeholder management experience Waterfall methodologies French speaking Some understanding of the financial services industry. Remote working, with occasional client travel (expensed) 


We are open to applicants based anywhere in the EU, such as from countries including France, Belgium, Switzerland or Poland.

Accessibility Statement

Read and apply for this role in the way that works for you by using our Recite Me assistive technology tool. Click the circle at the bottom right side of the screen and select your preferences.

We make an active choice to be inclusive towards everyone every day.? Please let us know if you require any accessibility adjustments through the application or interview process.

Our Commitment To Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

Signify’s mission is to empower every person, regardless of their background or circumstances, with an equitable chance to achieve the careers they deserve. Building a diverse future, one placement at a time.

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Specialist: Remote, Flexible, Purpose-Driven Career
jobs.description:
About Us

Were a fast-growing team united by a mission: helping people unlock their full potential.

Through award-winning transformational programs and retreats, we help people break through limitations, gain clarity, and create extraordinary lives. Our team is made up of positive, proactive leaders who believe in growth, freedom, and making a difference. Joining us means becoming part of something bigger than yourself.

What You'll Gain

100% Remote work from anywhere in the worldFlexible hours design your ideal work-life balancePerformance-based earnings no capTraining & support access to world-class tools and supportPurpose-driven work market programs that change lives globally


What You'll Do

Run and optimize digital campaigns (social, email, paid ads)Create compelling content to engage and attract new audiencesTrack performance with analytics and improve ROICollaborate with a supportive, high-performance global teamStay ahead of trends in online marketing and personal growth


What We're Looking For

Proven experience in digital marketing (paid ads, content, or social media)Creative, proactive, and results-driven mindsetStrong communication skills and attention to detailPassion for personal growth, coaching, or online learningEntrepreneurial spirit and comfort working independently


Please Note: This is a performance-based, self-employed opportunity with full onboarding and support.

If you're ready to grow your career, create impact, and enjoy the freedom of working on your own terms, apply now and join our global movement.
